image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: A former student teacher is found guilty of persistent child sex abuse, and other charges, against a 15-year-old-boy.

title.children: Former student teacher found guilty by Canberra jury of sexual offences against 15-year-old boy

image.altText: Graffiti Accused

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man is charged with five counts of damaging property after the incidents, which occurred between February and June.

title.children: Man arrested for allegedly spray-painting pro-Palestinian slogans on War Memorial and ABC buildings in Canberra

image.altText: Elizabeth wears a dark coat and stands ebhind microphones, with Leanne standing behind her and an Emergency sign behind them.

props.synopsis: Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee confirms Darren Roberts, a candidate who shared controversial social media posts under a pseudonym, will contest next month's ACT election for the party.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee says candidate who shared controversial posts under fake profile will contest ACT election

image.altText: Portrait of Shane Rattenbury sitting on a small wall with bushland down a mountain behind him.

props.synopsis: The idea of a Greens politician running a government in Australia seems like a far-fetched notion, but Shane Rattenbury says he wants to be ACT chief minister.

title.children: Shane Rattenbury has said he wants to be ACT chief minister â€” what chance does he have?

image.altText: A woman speaks in front of some microphones wearing a campaign jacket.

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Kikkert was disendorsed by the Liberals two weeks ago over allegations about donations and behaviour towards staff.

title.children: 'Lowest political game': Former Canberra Liberals MLA Elizabeth Kikkert defends actions after CCTV clip released

image.altText: A collection of printed artifacts.

props.synopsis: After hitting peak popularity in the 1960s and 70s many museums have closed or are struggling to keep their doors open. Some blame a generational gap, sparking calls to rethink how to bring history to a younger audience.

title.children: Bega Pioneers' Museum one of many struggling to get volunteers, let alone visitors, as interests change

image.altText: A graphic shows a food delivery app surrounded by a ghost-like haze.

props.synopsis: Have you noticed new dining options popping up on food delivery apps, but can't find their local shopfront? Chances are the food comes from a dark kitchen, also known as ghost or cloud kitchens.

title.children: Multiple restaurants from one location: your food might be being made in a ghost kitchen

image.altText: A man watching football having an angry reaction

props.synopsis: The AFL and NRL grand finals are a time of celebration for many, but experts warn it can be a period of heightened risk for domestic violence. Berry Street, a domestic violence support service, is preparing for a busy weekend, after experiencing a 30 to 40 per cent increase in demand during the 2023 grand final weekend.

title.children: Footy, fans and family violence: Why experts say major sporting events are the 'perfect storm'

image.altText: Woman grocery shopping in dairy aisle

props.synopsis: A new report from the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission has found many Australians have lost trust in supermarkets as it investigates the mega grocers' market power and potential barriers to entry in the sector.

title.children: ACCC supermarket inquiry investigating Coles and Woolworths' market power and barriers to entry

image.altText: A suited man speaks at a press conference in front of the Israeli flag

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister made an outright rejection of calls for a ceasefire with Lebanon's Hezbollah, citing the safety of citizens in northern Israel.

title.children: Netanyahu arrives in US for key speech declaring Israel will continue fighting Hezbollah with 'full force'

image.altText: A soldier covers his ears as a tank explodes

props.synopsis: Israel has been giving strong signals it plans to launch a ground invasion of Lebanon as part of its war against Hezbollah, but whether it has learnt from its last military campaign in the country remains to be seen.

title.children: What Israel can learn from its 2006 ground invasion of Lebanon, which 'failed completely'

image.altText: Women in blue suits holding red folders throw white documents in the air

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Supreme Court quashes a tribunal decision that would have forced a museum to allow men to enter its women-only "Ladies' Lounge".

title.children: 'Women are better than men': Mona curator celebrates after Supreme Court win for ladies lounge

image.altText: Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with US President Joe Biden and Vice-President Kamala Harris at the White House after addressing the UN General Assembly this week.

title.children: Zelenskyy receives bipartisan support in Washington visit despite Republicans' claims of 'election interference'

image.altText: A composite of a man and a woman

props.synopsis: Election day on November 5 is shaping up to be an extremely tight race. So when scandals broke out in twoÂ US states, both sides of politics took notice.Â

title.children: In a US presidential election this close, could the outcome be swayed by two scandals â€” or the 'blue dot'?

image.altText: A graphic showing a microscopic photo of the mpox virus and a red arrow

props.synopsis: Between July and September 26, the number of mpox cases increased by more than 570 per cent to a total of 724. One way to address to growing number of cases is increasing vaccination rates.

title.children: Mpox spread accelerates in Australia with 85pc of this year's cases recorded since July

image.altText: Elderly Torres Strait island man in hospital on dialysis machine

props.synopsis: First Nations people in the Torres Strait and Cape York are dying of preventable diseases at more than twice the overall rate for Queensland, prompting calls to return to a healthcare model developed 30 years ago.Â

title.children: Torres Strait and Cape York leaders say a failing health system leading to 'too many funerals'

image.altText: Brodie Grundy and Oscar McInerney contest for the ball during an AFL match between the Sydney Swans and Brisbane Lions

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans will take on the Brisbane Lions on Saturday, with Katy Perry providing pre-show entertainment at the MCG.

title.children: The 2024 AFL grand final has almost arrived. Here's how to watch and what to expect

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The local share market has risen on open, while all eyes are on Coles and Woolworths following a report out today from the competition watchdog. The prime minister warns the supermarkets' behaviour is a "breach of trust". Follow the day's events and insights as they happenÂ on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Australian share market rises, ACCC report finds Australians don't trust supermarkets

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX flat in afternoon trade, Star shares down 43%
World coffee, sugar prices surge as drought-hit Brazil awaits rains

image.altText: A bird's-eye view of a steel-frame dome structure on a concrete base, with cranes either side and a desert backdrop.

props.synopsis: High in the Chilean desert, the Extremely Large Telescope is taking shape. It promises sharper views of space than we've ever seen â€” but will Australian astronomers be able to use it?

title.children: 'We will not fail': The Extremely Large Telescope in Chile is astronomy's next big thing â€” if it works

image.altText: Man holds rock lobster

props.synopsis: While the Liberal-turned-independent SA state MP has been facing and denying the charges for seven years, he has now been found guilty â€” but his fate as a parliamentarian remains unclear.

title.children: A state MP has been found guilty of theft and dishonesty â€” will he stay in parliament?

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Zheng Shanjie shake hands in front of a small table with the Chinese and Australian flags.

props.synopsis: Mr Chalmers is in Beijing to co-chair the first Australia-China Strategic Economic Dialogue in seven years, as well as to better understand the challenges facing the Chinese economy.

title.children: In Beijing for historic talks, Chalmers says China's economic growth is in Australia's interest

image.altText: Man speaks in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: Mayor Troy Thompson, who is being investigated by the crime and corruption watchdog for allegedly misrepresenting his military and education history, claims the premier's move is "political grandstanding".

title.children: Queensland premier seeks legal advice over future of embattled Townsville mayor

image.altText: Hundreds of people form a circle around an image of a whale tale made of seaweed on the beach

props.synopsis: Three-line email calls off an international conglomerate's bid to conduct Australia's largest seismic blast survey in search of gas in the Otway Basin.

title.children: Opponents celebrate as plan abandoned for major seismic testing off Victoria

image.altText: LOST PARADISE

props.synopsis: The US ticket-selling platform Lyte has shut down, leaving two Australian music festivals in the lurch.Â

title.children: 'We are taking this situation seriously': Aussie festivals respond after US ticketing agent shuts down

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: For many of us, COVID has become just a bad memory, despite its lasting and mixed legacies. But experts are urging that we learn from our mistakes and plan ahead.Â

title.children: Pandemics don't give much notice of their arrival â€” so Albanese is being urged to get ready

image.altText: an aerial shot of a long, straight and dusty road with pastoral land on either side of it on a clear day

props.synopsis: Licensing approvals have been granted for a uranium exploration project in a remote area of South Australia. The project, spanning a total 3,000 square kilometres, is expected to start in October.

title.children: Search for uranium in massive area of outback SA gets the green light

image.altText: Two men in muscular outfits

props.synopsis: Two non-Victorian clubs are set to meet in the 2024 AFL Grand Final, prompting thousands of fans to travel interstate in the hopes of seeing their team win the premiership.

title.children: Fans flock to Melbourne's AFL grand final parade ahead of Swans and Lions blockbuster

image.altText: Race winner Daniel Ricciardo screams in excitement standing on the top step of the podium as wine is sprayed in celebration

props.synopsis: Daniel Ricciardo's time in Formula 1 appears over and it ended with a whimper. But the Australian should always be remembered as an outstanding driver whose contribution to F1 makes him a great of the sport.

title.children: Forget the sad ending, Daniel Ricciardo should be remembered as one of his generation's best drivers and an icon of F1

image.altText: Walters

props.synopsis: A tearful Kevin Walters has urged fans to stick with the Brisbane Broncos after the club announced he would no longer be head coach.

title.children: Emotional Walters urges fans to stick with Broncos as club begins search for new coach

image.altText: Queensland Fire and Rescue Service

props.synopsis: A review into the QFD's complaint system released on Friday found "a concerning upward trend in customer and stakeholder complaints", with the monthly average almost doubling from 28 in 2021 to "a troubling" 50 in 2023.

title.children: Queensland Fire Department's 'command and control' structure 'shielded perpetrators', report finds

image.altText: A man with a concerned look on his face

props.synopsis: Eric Adams vows to fight US prosecutors on a case alleging he accepted illegal campaign contributions and luxury travel from foreign nationals for many years.

title.children: New York Mayor Eric Adams charged in bribery and fraud scheme stretching back 10 years

image.altText: A composite image

props.synopsis: Righto then, smarty pants, test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Surprise Aria nods, Pesto the penguin, and a new Socceroos coach

image.altText: A woman wearing a United Workers Union Hat

props.synopsis: With three SA tomato businesses, including a major supplier, forced into quarantine because of the outbreak of a crop virus, workers like Sharon Tarisesei have lost their jobs, and are apprehensive about securing future employment.

title.children: Tomato virus outbreak leaves migrant farm workers facing battle to 'make ends meet'

image.altText: A man in blue shirt.

props.synopsis: A Hong Kong court sentences a former editor to jail for 21 months and immediately released another after they had earlier been found guilty of conspiring to publish seditious articles in a ruling that has prompted an international outcry.

title.children: Hong Kong court sentences former news editor in landmark sedition case

image.altText: Adam Driver in Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis

props.synopsis: For better or worse, Frances Ford Coppola's long-awaited passion project featuring a laundry list of high-profile actors has finally hit cinemas.

title.children: Megalopolis took more than 40 years and $120m to make. It's been worth every bit of trouble
